alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 2:20PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Gloucester, Middlesex, King and Queen, Northumberland, northwestern Charles City, Richmond, New Kent, Westmoreland, southeastern King William, Essex and Lancaster Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Colonial Beach to near Millers Tavern to near Providence Forge. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Kent, King William, Colonial Beach, West Point, Tappahannock, Warsaw, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Montross, Champlain, Fair Port, Talleysville, Saint Stephens Church, Robley, King And Queen Court House, Roxbury, Callao, Lancaster, White Stone and Kinsale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for eastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
